text: Rodin is a 2017 drama film directed by Jacques Doillon. It was selected to compete for the Palme d'Or in the main competition section at the 2017 Cannes Film Festival. ==Cast== * Vincent Lindon as Auguste Rodin * Izïa Higelin as Camille Claudel * Séverine Caneele as Rose Beuret * Bernard Verley as Victor Hugo * Anders Danielsen Lie as Rainer Maria Rilke * Arthur Nauzyciel as Paul Cézanne * Laurent Poitrenaux as Octave Mirbeau * Olivier Cadiot as Claude Monet * Edward Akrout as Edward Steichen ==Reception== On review aggregator Rotten Tomatoes, the film holds an approval rating of 29%, based on 35 reviews with an average rating of 3.7/10. The website's critical consensus states, "Rodin falls prey to the most common pitfall of artist biopics: depicting creative work without ever really unlocking what it means or why it's important." Metacritic gives the film a weighted average score of 39 out of 100, based on 14 critics, indicating "generally unfavorable reviews". ==See also== * Camille Claudel, 1988 film * Camille Claudel 1915, 2013 film ==References== ==External links== * Category:2017 films Category:2017 drama films Category:2017 biographical drama films Category:2010s historical drama films Category:French films Category:Belgian films Category:French biographical drama films Category:Belgian biographical drama films Category:French historical drama films Category:Belgian historical drama films Category:Biographical films about artists Category:Films set in the 19th century Category:Films set in Paris Category:French-language films Category:Films directed by Jacques Doillon Category:Cultural depictions of Auguste Rodin Category:Cultural depictions of Camille Claudel
title: Rodin (film)
